com.registry

Class RegistryValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.registry.RegistryValue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Comparable<RegistryValue>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RegBinaryValue, RegDWORDValue, RegMultiStringValue, RegQWORDValue, RegStringValue

    public abstract class RegistryValue
extends Object
implements Cloneable, Comparable<RegistryValue>, Serializable

    This class represents a named value that is found in the registry. Each value has a specific name which refers to the value as well as a type. The different types can be found in ValueType.

    The data that is associated with the value depends on the type. For instance if a value was of type REG_SZ, then the data is a String type. If the type was REG_MULTI_SZ, then the data is an array of Strings.

    This class can only retrieve the data in binary form. In order to obtain the data in its expected form, this class must be type cast into the appropriate class representing the value type for the named value.
    For example: REG_SZ values must be type cast into RegStringValue.

    Version:
    1.8
    Author:
    Yinon Michaeli
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(RegistryValue o)
        Implements the compareTo method in the interface Comparable. Allows a list of RegistryValues to be sorted in ascending order. Null values always come before non-null values.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<RegistryValue>
        Parameters:
        o - A RegistryValue to compare against this.
        Returns:
        An integer describing which one should be sorted first: if < 0, this should go first if > 0, o should go first

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object o)
        Tests for equality with another Object. Two Objects are equal if they are both of type RegistryValue, they are both found in the same key, and their names, type, and data are the same.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        o - An Object to test equality with.
        Returns:
        true if the two are equal, false otherwise.

      • refreshData

        public abstract int refreshData()
        This method is used to update the data for this value because the data does not update automatically if it was changed.
        Returns:
        An integer error code which tells if the operation was successful or not. To obtain a description of the error, use RegistryKey.formatErrorMessage(int).
        Since:
        1.5

      • getByteData

        public byte[] getByteData()
        Used to retrieve the byte information of the data from the registry. If the specific type is wanted, then this must be type cast to the corresponding subclass based on the type of the value.

        If the data cannot be read, then null is returned.
        Returns:
        An array of bytes which represent the data of the value or null if the data cannot be read.

      • setByteData

        public int setByteData(byte... value)
        Used to change the bytes of the data for this value.
        Parameters:
        value - An array of bytes which will be the new data for the value. NOTE: As of version 1.7.6, this can now be a variable list of bytes.
        Returns:
        An integer error code which tells if the operation was successful or not. To obtain a description of the error, use RegistryKey.formatErrorMessage(int).

      • getByteLength

        public int getByteLength()
        Used to retrieve the number of bytes the data takes up in the registry.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes for the value's data or -1 if the value doesn't exist.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Retrieve a String representation of this value.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        A String representation for the value.
